column4: Could someone please do a sudo opcontrol --no-vmlinux --start and tell me what it says on Edgy? I think opcontrol is broken
No, not harmful. And thanks, but mind the pasting.
You'll want to run sudo opcontrol --shutdown before much longer.
It's not harmful but it does create system overhead while it's running.
ohh i dont think it will mess with me compiling a kernel will it?
It will not cause errors, but it will slow the compiling down about 1%-8%
There's no reason to leave it running if you're not using it. It's for collecting performance data.
Thanks for the help. I guess it's just F'd on my laptop and my desktop in exactly the same way, but not yours.
Huh. That's so weird. Because opcontrol is a shell script, and when I start it, I get an error from the interpreter.
I never mess with kernel patching. I just download the full source tarball each time.
I have never tried compiling an FBSD kernel, but I admire their philosophy.
to tell u the truth even thoug u have to configure everything by hand its a whole lot easier cause they have that darn handbook
